title: First Fridays Art Walk
description: Monthly gallery walk featuring dozens of galleries, studios, and pop-up exhibitions along Broad Street. Meet local artists, enjoy live music, and discover Richmond's thriving arts scene.

title: South of the James Market
description: Richmond's beloved farmers market featuring local produce, artisan goods, prepared foods, and live music. Rain or shine, every Saturday.

title: RVA Zinefest
description: Annual celebration of DIY publishing featuring zine makers, comic artists, printmakers, and small press publishers from across the region.

title: Hardywood Night Market
description: Monthly night market at Hardywood featuring local vendors, food trucks, craft beer, and live entertainment.

title: Church Hill Irish Festival
description: Annual St. Patrick's Day celebration featuring Irish music, dancing, food, and drinks in historic Church Hill.

title: RVA Jazz Jam
description: Weekly jazz jam session welcoming musicians of all levels. Bring your instrument or just come to listen and enjoy.

title: Carytown Watermelon Festival
description: The biggest street festival on the East Coast! Watermelon eating contests, live music on multiple stages, 150+ vendors, and summer vibes.

title: Poetry Night at Chop Suey Books
description: Open mic poetry night at Richmond's beloved independent bookstore. Sign up at the door, all voices welcome.

title: Scott's Addition Porchfest
description: Free neighborhood music festival featuring local bands performing on porches and patios throughout Scott's Addition.

title: 2nd Street Festival
description: Annual celebration of African American culture and heritage in historic Jackson Ward. Music, food, art, and community.
